intro: Stephanomeria carotifera, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, round seed pods that contain numerous seeds. Stephanomeria carotifera is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and its ecological benefits.
